sentences.sContent: The danger lies in its unpredictability. Yet that may also be a reason for hope.
sentences.sContent_eng: The danger lies in its unpredictability. Yet that may also be a reason for hope.
sentences.sCn: 危险就在于其不可预测性，而这也可能是希望尚存的一个原因吧。

sentences.sContent: With the unpredictability of the volcano, authorities widened the danger zone around the mountain to 20 kilometers.
sentences.sContent_eng: With the unpredictability of the volcano, authorities widened the danger zone around the mountain to 20 kilometers.
sentences.sCn: 鉴于这一火山的不可预测性，印尼官员将“危险区域”扩大到方圆20公里。

sentences.sContent: While the West views democracy as an advantage since it can offer United States an institutional and bloodless process for renewal, Beijing views it as a source of irrationality and unpredictability.
sentences.sContent_eng: While the West views democracy as an advantage since it can offer United States an institutional and bloodless process for renewal, Beijing views it as a source of irrationality and unpredictability.
sentences.sCn: 尽管西方认为民主是一种优势，可以给美国提供一种制度上的、不流血的更新进程，但北京认为这是非理性和不可预测性的一个源头。

words.tran: 不可预知的；不定的；出乎意料的
无法预言地）；不可预见地（不能预料地
